abstract.text: A configuration you create to customize an indirect command buffer.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

abstract.text: Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
A command buffer containing reusable commands, encoded either on the CPU or GPU.
A configuration you create to customize an indirect command buffer.
The set of command types that you can encode into the indirect command buffer.
A Boolean value that determines where commands in the indirect command buffer get their buffer arguments from when you execute them.
A Boolean value that determines where commands in the indirect command buffer get their pipeline state from when you execute them.
The maximum number of buffers that you can set per command for the fragment stage.
The maximum number of buffers that you can set per command for the compute kernel.
The maximum number of buffers that you can set per command for the vertex stage.
A range of commands in an indirect command buffer.
Creates a command execution range.
The types of commands that you can encode into the indirect command buffer.
Configure a descriptor to specify the properties of an indirect command buffer.
Reduce CPU overhead and simplify your command execution by reusing commands.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Encoding Indirect Command Buffers on the CPU

abstract.text: Maximize CPU to GPU parallelization by generating render commands on the GPU.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Encoding Indirect Command Buffers on the GPU

abstract.text: Use indirect commands if you don’t know your draw or dispatch call arguments when you encode the command.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Specifying Drawing and Dispatch Arguments Indirectly

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
